title: @Riot A Serious Insight on How to Help Kindred
body:
Allow me to preface this by stating that I've been playing Kindred pretty much exclusively since release. I've played across several accounts but here is the one I currently play on. http://na.op.gg/summoner/userName=Dodge+Lamb+SRT10

It's not to gloat or try to say I'm better than other people, only to try and back up myself as a credible player that is genuinely interested in trying to help the champion.

I have one very short and simple buff, but before I state it, I want to go over why I feel what I'm about to say is a necessary change.

I am actually very happy with Kindred's mini-rework (Despite being harsh about it early on), and I think the champ is almost at a great state of balance, but we could get even closer. Kindred is a champion that, if played proficiently, can out-duel and out-skirmish almost every jungler in the game, even the ones that many people consider hard counters (such as Elise, Kha'Zix, etc.).

What I've actually noticed from the champion's release is that Kindred has not fairly often had times where beating other champs was a tall task, even with all the sustainability nerfs. I know some people are going to find that ludicrous, but the average Kindred player really does not understand the potential of the champion, which pains me to observe. The main issue is (who would've guessed) how Kindred is supposed to balance between getting stacks and pulling off successful ganks.

Understandably, Kindred has a dash, albeit very small, that operates on a small cooldown window inside of Wolf's Frenzy. The issue is that, in the early game, this ability is on too high of a cooldown to have meaningful chase potential without red buff, and even with it, to be honest.

Take the newest addition to the jungle, for example: Ezreal. While both marksmen, Ezreal is a champion that shines in the early game through his ability to enter a lane with Mystic Shot to apply his Red Buff from a large distance to slow, and close in with Arcane Shift for a strong burst combo, and finish them off with Essence Flux and his superior attack speed (At least early game, Ezreal's passive outshines Kindred's Q Attack Speed steroid quite heavily) whilst landing extra Mystic Shots.

Compare this to Kindred, who typically only has time to land two Dance of Arrows.  They also miss a lot of bites from Wolf's Frenzy because most of the time you cannot be in position to maximize its damage output, and Mounting Dread can only be used as a finisher for a notable amount of damage. For a dash that's smaller on a champion with less range and less up-front damage, it's hard to get the kills you need to allow your team and yourself to get ahead on Kindred. It doesn't feel right for a champion _designed for the jungle_, compared to Ezreal, a champion who is not.

Kindred also has an average clear speed compared to the typical jungler, which gets progressively worse if you cannot find stacks in the early game. For a champion that's reliant on getting those stacks, they just don't feel nimble enough to get around the map and contest with their low movement speed.

There's a lot more points I want to make, but the longer I think about what I've wrote, the more convoluted I feel my words become, so I'll keep it there.

What I propose is to have Dance of Arrows cooldown inside Wolf's Frenzy changed from to 3/2.75/2.5/2.25/2 from 4/3.5/3/2.5/2. I think this allows for Kindred to be able to capitalize on their gank damage in a more timely fashion and keep up with those faster champions that can walk away due to Kindred's low base Range. I also feel that a change like this still allows for their jungle clear to be healthy as you will roughly always get the same amount of jumps per use of W as on current. And if we _really_ want to get nitpicky about separating a great Kindred player from an average, this also makes getting two jumps per camp at Level 2 much more consistent (based on how fast you can press Q after auto attacking, it's almost frame perfect status with a standard 13.5% AS page).

I also think that it is possible to buff the cooldown of Dance of Arrows outside of Wolf's Frenzy to around 6 or 7 seconds (Likely the latter, maybe even 8) and possibly change the mana cost back down to 30 from 35. This would really help in allowing Kindred to move around the map a lot better to be able to contest stacks more often.

Kindred's problem has never been based around combat power, in my opinion. The typical player keeps saying that their ability to fight other champs is moot, or that stacks are impossible to get, and I feel that this issue stems directly from never really having the ability to move around the map well like other champions can, due to the combination of low base movement speed and lengthy early cooldowns on Dance of Arrows.

I really hope to see input from a Rioter or from anybody interested in logically debating on my ideas. I've been a diehard Kindred fan since their announcement and I want to see people be able to experience them without wanting to claw their eyes out.

replies.body:
Don't have a lot of time to devote to this thread, but wanted to put in my 2 cents as the dev who last worked on her mini-update. 

In short, I think you make a very reasonable argument. I too think that Kindred needs a bit more love to reach an optimal balance state. We have discussed buffing them recently, but they slipped in priority due to other stuff going (yay Preseason). I do believe we will be devoting time to them in the near future and that most devs on the Live Gameplay team feel that they need some love. 

Not sure if our analysis will land exactly where yours did, but you do bring up a valid angle. I know in the past that their Q cooldown was a very sensitive lever to tune due to how slippery they can become. I think we would have to spend a lot of diligence in validating if a Q buff is the correct direction to take their next set of changes. I think there is a lot to be improved in Kindred's mark mini-game still as well for instance. 

Base MS is also a pretty attractive lever to me at first blush as well. Hopefully we will have time to address their current state in the coming patches or right after Runes Reforged.
If being slippery turns out to be a problem, maybe have the dash be a shorter distance when dashing away and a longer distance when dashing towards an enemy?
Thank you for your response, I really appreciate it. I do think mobility is their core issue, but I'll be curious to find out how you guys tackle the problem.

For what it's worth I'm interested in a buff to Q in that cooldown reduction also applies to the W+Q combo. So when at 2 seconds base cooldown by level 9 a Kindred with 40% CDR can Q every 1.2 seconds. I like this because one thing that I hoped to be addressed with the rework was build variety, which I feel still isn't in a good spot. 

But I also really like the idea OP had, as well as the possibility of a base MS buff. There's a reason Mobi's were so popular for a while pre-rework.

EDIT: Also some decent skins please. Any of the ideas artwork posted to /r/kindred would do nicely. Elderwood, Tribal, hell existing lines like Dark Star would have been perfect too.

My biggest problem with Kindred is the stacking system.  It forces you to get ahead and most players aren't able to capitalize on it.  If your teammates are feeding, you can't capitalize on it.

Also, wolf is pretty stupid (or just being an a - -) asking you to get a mob in the enemy's jungle when your mid towers are down and the enemy's mid towers are up.  If your mid lost lane, his marks are pretty much useless.

While I agree that Kindred's stacking system isn't very intuitive, it rewards good vision control, awareness and instinct to be able to capitalize on being at the right place at the right time.

That's essentially why I suggested the additional buff to Q base cooldown and mana cost. It allows people, if they choose to, the ability to maneuver around the map to be able to contest more freely without just giving a straight up movement speed buff that's all too powerful on its own for a marksman.

Also Wolf is lame. Like, he always marks the opposite scuttle on purpose. He can eat some poo.

The issue is that if kindred is back to a point of being able to reliably get marks, they are instantly back into the OP state thanks to the nature of the passive being by design simultaneously scaling and snowballing. Honestly the passive has to go completely but since it is such an extreme part of their kit we would basically looking at a rework were only the ult ends up likely surviving.

Once you hit the first four you just try to play like a second ADC and if you can get more cool but don't do shit like suicide for them because they don't give you damage anymore, just damage potential. I tried to apply that and did happen to do better but I'm also an ADC main in Silver with an interest in learning and improving so I may have just been playing with apes who don't want to try as hard as I do. But yeah overall that's my take on Kindred, get your four and just deal with scraping by after that.

3/2.75/2.5/2.25/2 is mostly to keep the cooldown curve smooth. There's no proper way to scale 3.5 down to 2 in 5 intervals.

You'd be surprised at how little of an affect it has on jungle clear, it would actually be next to negligible. The main issue this would fix is having such elongated gank patterns. I cannot stress enough how long it takes for Kindred to put in the same amount of damage in a gank compared to other junglers because of how long Q's 4 second cooldown is. Thankfully at level 4 it changes, but by level 4 some early games can be over before you can have any impact.

The reason I compared Ezreal is because they're both marksman, they're both scaling glass cannons in the jungle and they share a decently similar playstyle. It's just a bit baffling that an AD Carry can have such poor rates in their main role and crush a marksman intended for the Jungle, if that makes any sense.

It really would. You could double up the heal with the now-existing Warlord's and run a slightly more durable build to make most people want to quit life. It also means they would never take damage in the jungle.

It's a real shame, too, because I absolutely _loved_ the animation and sound that came with it.

One thing that has always irked me is that Wolf's theme is chasing down people that run, but running away is literally the best way to deal with wolf. Maybe if there was some sort of mechanic where if you've been attacked by Wolf and you leave the AoE, you get slowed.
So in essence, the same as Illaoi's Test of Spirit (E). I could dig that, or maybe even slow them on Wolf's first bite against them.

It could place a debuff on you if you leave the AoE, something like: If an enemy champ leaves Wolf's range, Lamb's next three auto attacks have special effects for ~2 seconds (extended by auto attacks made by Lamb). The first two auto attacks steal 20% of the target's movement speed, and the third auto attack deals missing %HP damage.
This isn't really related to your discussion but what order do you level your abilities in when jungling as Kindred? Also what items do you build in general cases?

You could've checked my op.gg for that :'D

Always Q W E, Q max -> W max -> E max. While people think E max is stronger (And in some cases, it is), W max is a lot more versatile as the higher damage allows you to shred tanks quicker, have a stronger magic damage share, and have your Q up more often if need be.

Items vary across the board, but there are three simple ones you can try. (All of them use Berserker's Greaves)

Crit build: Warrior -> BF Sword -> Shiv -> IE -> RFC -> GA/LW/BT - Keep in mind that if you use this build, opt for Warlord's or Stormraider's if you really feel you can utilize it. Warlord's is a staple though, as you'll need a form of sustain to make up for the lack of lifesteal throughout the majority, if not all of most games.

Bork build: Warrior -> Bork -> Hurricane -> LW -> GA - This build is deceptively strong. Kindred's AD ratios got buffed enough to make a build like this benefit from taking Warrior over Bloodrazor. Your skirmish and team fight potential with Hurricane bolts from 575+ range with stacks is actually insane, whilst offering good enough lifesteal to keep you up during the mid game. This has become my standard build, as it fixes Kindred's stale mid game issues while still scaling well into the late game.

Whatever Forest Within does: It's like Warrior -> Black Cleaver -> Frozen Mallet and some other stuff. I don't like this, but it supposedly still works. I don't even think he does it anymore? But I haven't seen him play in a hot second myself.

Important to note that you want Fervor on any build that isn't crit, and while I think you can use it on the crit build, you _really_ need Warlords to offset the lack of sustain.

She should be a true death transformation champion where death shifts your form from kindred to wolf whenever you die, or alternatively a death tally based off of kills/assists/large monsters that allows for a extended wolf transformation much like shyvannas dragon mechanic.
